elements.title: Powis Castle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Elisabeth Whittle, a garden historian, considers the gardens at Powis Castle (pictured) to be the most important and magnificent in Wales?

elements.title: Walter White (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Walter White was a member of the prosecution for the Scopes trial in 1925 despite not passing the bar until 1944?

elements.title: Team Jorge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the investigation of Team Jorge, an Israeli disinformation outfit, led to the suspension of a prominent French news anchor?

elements.title: No, Ma'am, That's Not History (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that No, Ma'am, That's Not History, Hugh Nibley's rebuttal to Fawn Brodie's divisive biography of Joseph Smith, started a trend of polemics in Mormon apologetics?

elements.title: fossils thought to be ancient marine animals (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some fossils thought to be ancient marine animals have been reinterpreted as seaweeds?

elements.title: Thomas Highgate (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Thomas Highgate was the first British soldier on the Western Front to be executed for desertion during the First World War?

elements.title: AFL Women's season seven (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Brisbane Lions' AFL women's team in the AFL Women's season seven became the first AFLW team to score more than 200 points across the first three rounds of a season?

elements.title: Carlisle Turkish baths (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the 1960s one could have tea and toast served to your changing room at the Carlisle Turkish baths in England?
